Role: The Resposibility of this department is to give special focus on Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes for their socio-economic advancement.;Government has taken several steps by framing policies for creating favourable environment to ensure speedy socio-economic development of Adi Dravidars and Tribals.;Major activities for these communities are Educational & Economic development and Special Component Plan for Adi Dravidars and the Tribal Sub Plan for Tribals.

Agriculture is the most predominant sector of the State economy.;The main roles and responsibilities of this Department are to ensure stability in Agricultural production$ to increase the agricultural production in a sustainable manner$ to ensure Food requirement of growing population of the state$ to moniter proper raw material needs of agro based industries and providing employment opportunities to the rural population.;Tamil Nadu has all along been one of the states with a creditable performance in agricultural production with the farmers relatively more responsive and receptive to changing technologies and market forces.;The Agriculture Department has taken up the challenge to achieve higher growth rate in agriculture by implementing several development schemes and also propagation of relevant technologies to step up the production.

COMMERCIAL TAXES department earn the highest tax revenue for the Govnt of Tamil Nadu; REGISTRATION DEPARTMENT rendering service to the Public for about 138 years occupies the third place;

This department play a prominent role in the day to day affairs of the common man;help the farmer to improve agricultural production;by providing crop loans;and by supplying agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides;enable the farmer to store and market his produce;cooperatives run the fair price shops provide the rural and urban poor essential commodities at highly subsidized prices; ensure adequate availability of essential commodities affordable price to the general public particularly the poor;PDS has one of the most crucial elements in food policy and food security system in the country.

This department takes responsibilities for sustainable growth of economy;Power development is an important input for the States Industrial Commercial and Socio economic growth;the availability of affordable reliable and quality power is necessary;augmenting power supply to bridge the gap between demand and supply; increasing future demand;Government is giving importance to power sector in Tamil Nadu

ENVIRONMENT department is essential for the survival and growth of all living things;Sustainable development rests on three pillars are economic growth social progress and protection of the environment;FORESTS department provide environmental stability ecological security food security and water security to the country;And also provide livelihood security to the forest fringe people;

This Department takes responsibility of managing the public finances of the Government of Tamil Nadu;important role in the preparation of the State Budget; Finance Department being the custodian of the State Exchequer;overall responsibility of balancing receipts and payments; to ensure that debt obligations;Finance Department makes critical scrutiny of the proposals of the Departments;evaluates the proposals to needs cost effectiveness budget provisions&financial procedure;importance of balancing receipts and expenditure; achieving the fiscal objectives of the Government

Role: This department plays a vital role in all round development of the Society;healthy population can contribute overall economic growth of the country;a healthy society not only making quality medicare facilities;also focusing on preventive health care and adoption;The State is fast emerging a good public health especially for maternal and child care;There is also significant progress in the eradication of HIV/AIDS;Tamil Nadu State AIDS Control Society is focusing to make Tamil Nadu âAIDS free and no new Infection Stateâ by 2012;There is an urgent need now to focus our attention on non-communicable diseases like diabetes hypertension cardiovascular diseases &cancer;emerging major causes of morbidity and mortality in our society;These diseases can be tackled only by a two pronged strategy;includes creating awareness for prevention through life style as well as early detection and treatment

Higher Education builds capacity in our people;also provides a high quality of life;higher education emerge as centres of innovation excellence and development; provide;higher education to students from rural and backward areas and marginalized families;aim is to develop and enhance talent and skills in our youth;to equip and enable them to meet the emerging challenges and demands of the century

This department has a strong industrial base which contributes substantially to the industrial production of the country;Road and bridge infrastructure along with ports play a vital role in the development of key sectors of the economy like Industry Technology &Agriculture;main objectives of the department are to maintain and improve the roads under the control of the Government;The department is also in-charge of improvement and maintenance of National Highways in the State;Highways Department of Tamil Nadu aims to develop and maintain the Highway network in the State;ensure road safety and hassle free traffic

Home Department is responsible for the administration of Police Subordinate work Prisons and Transport in the State;The Constitution of India under Entries 8 and 51 of the State List of the Seventh Schedule provides powers to the State Government

Tamil Nadu has been following housing policy by creating conditions conducive to the provision of quality housing at affordable cost;especially to the Economically Weaker Sections by regulating and encouraging developments through planned inclusions and balanced growth; the Government has incorporated the regulatory framework by making it mandatory for developers;to provide 10 percentage of the developed area for the Economically Weaker Sections;The Government would involve the various stakeholders in the provision of housing at an affordable price;Â through facilitation and regulation of the housing services; regulatory bodies also take up several initiatives to improve traffic and transportation and upgradation of infrastructural facilities

This Department predominantly looked after the welfare of non-industrial labour;rapid growth of the economy;the role of department has widened to cover not only workers in organised sector but also in the unorganised sector;department has been striving to achieve this important task through the legal frame work of the Industrial Disputes Act;department is effectively protecting the interests of the workers engaged in organised and unorganised sectors;implementing various Acts to maintain good industrial relations and promote welfare of workers

This department takes responsibilities to maintain order and to provide protection to persons and property;laws may seek to enforce justice morality or any other normative end;law is nothing more than that a set of rules to provide order and governance of society;Human experience is the basis of law;it is designed to meet dynamic social needs;treating law as an applied science which uses functional methods to investigate analyse and solve social problems;it adopts a realistic approach and defines law primarily in terms of judicial precedents

This Department is responsible for the development of urban areas in the State;ensuring provision of water supply to all the areas of the State;the aim and objective of the Government to develop the Urban Local Bodies into self-reliant institutions of local governance;to achieve a strong and motivated workforce and committed elected representatives;the capacity building activities for the functionaries will be streamlined and strengthened all the Urban Local Bodies to achieve excellence in Urban Governance;provide good quality of life and improve the living conditions of the urban citizens;Urban poverty has posed a major threat to equitable growth and development;Government is now focusing its efforts towards growth oriented policie;infrastructure development has been given a major thrust for the sustained growth of the urban areas

The Public Department functions under the direct control of the Chief Secretary deals with important matters concerning the General Administration of the State;Appointment of Honâble Ministers and related matters;Establishment matters relating to Office of the Honâble Chief Minister and Honâble Ministers;Arrangements for Cabinet Meetings;Protocol arrangements relating to visits of VVIPs VIPs and other Dignitaries;this department makes arrangements for the celebration of national functions such as Independence Day and Republic Day;Arrangements are made for administering pledge on special days announced by the Government of India such as Martyrs Day Anti-Terrorism Day National Integration Day at the Army Parade ground in Secretariat

Public Works Department is one of the oldest Service Departments of the Government serving for the past 153 years in the construction and maintenance of Government Buildings;Many buildings and monuments stand as testimony to our engineering skill;The Buildings Organisation provides structural safety to all public buildings adopting latest technology ;The Department is taking all efforts for better service delivery with long term vision;This department has long term vision for quality service for safe and purposeful public buildings adopting best evolved practices and advanced modern technologies; All the Monuments and Heritage buildings under the control of Government are being protected by PWD by keeping their Architectural Aesthetic Historic archeological and prominent symbolic values;The Public Works Department Buildings Organization constructs and maintains buildings of various Government Departments like School Education Health and Family Welfare Revenue Agriculture Animal Husbandry Dairying and Fisheries Tourism and Social Welfare Department;it provides quality services for Safe Government buildings at reasonable cost utilizing modern technologies and experience

The Department of Rural Development and Panchayat Raj is responsible for the implementation of various rural development and welfare schemes and facilitates Panchayat Raj Institutions;to discharge their duties and functions effectively to achieve the objectives of Local Self Governance;Government have improved the living standards and set the benchmark for the quality of rural lives;This Government is committed to provide all the basic amenities in the rural areas at the habitation level promote sanitation;reduce poverty;conserve the natural resources;minimize the urban-rural divide and ensure improvement in the quality of life of the rural people of Tamil Nadu

This department takes responsibilities to facilitate the welfare and all round development of the youth; department of Youth Welfare and Sports Development has been given a big thrust by the Government of Tamil Nadu; Youth are the pillar of strength of any nation; The mission of the department is to make Tamil Nadu a leading state in the sports arena by creating high quality infrastructure;promoting a sports culture; harnessing talent at the grass root level; Sports Development Authority of Tamil Nadu as the apex body for sports development in Tamil Nadu; implementing all the policy decisions on sports activities of the Government;Tamil Nadu has a cadet strength of 98790 under National Cadet Corps which is one of the highest in the country
